alert.note: Alert for Lane; Ness; Rush; Scott (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 28 at 12:12PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Kansas, south central Kansas, southwest Kansas and west central Kansas, including the following counties, in central Kansas, Rush. In south central Kansas, Barber, Comanche, Edwards, Kiowa, Pawnee, Pratt and Stafford. In southwest Kansas, Clark, Finney, Ford, Grant, Gray, Hamilton, Haskell, Hodgeman, Kearny, Meade, Morton, Seward, Stanton and Stevens. In west central Kansas, Lane, Ness and Scott. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Forecast models are showing widespread 2 to 4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts from Friday morning through Saturday afternoon. This could cause localized flash flooding especially in low lying areas prone to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
